Comment 2: 
Actually, I think our difference is in our interpretation of English. But maybe U.S.
English and British English are subtly different. Anyway, the way I read it is that
'simple' in the context of the sentence is not about simplicity (easy to understand,
that kind of thing), but about simpleness (only basic programs that can't do much).

If you won't change 'simple' to 'maintainable' what about changing it to
'understandable'?

(Anyway, I won't raise this again:-)
